programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Sarlat, heritage in its blood With seventy-five listed buildings in an area of only eleven hectares, Sarlat-la-Canéda, capital of the Périgord Noir, is renowned for having the highest density of historical monuments in the world. Éric Perrin invites you to join him in exploring the town and its incredibly rich heritage. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
They're the future of fashion: discover the fashion show for students of the Institut Français de la Mode. Learn all about the padded jacket. Interview with Valentine H Despointes, a leatherwork artist. Wearing the colour brown. The architect Régis Botta presents one of his projects: a bright, simple duplex.
Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Michel Roth
He is one of France's most highly-qualified chefs. Michel Roth is back in Marseille, where he spent his childhood and learned his trade. An opportunity for the Lorraine-born chef to immerse himself in the land he loves, surrounded by family and friends: where good food is served with emotion.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life as an outdoor adventure guide On the banks of Cambell River, Julien meets up with Bastian. Former banker turned helicopter pilot, he left Switzerland to start again from nothing. He takes Julien off to explore the endless playground that surrounds him, by boat, campervan and air. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Own brands
Are own brands, generally sold at lower prices, good quality? Also on the programme: how to prepare tempeh, the Indonesian speciality made from fermented soybeans? Discovering all about Argentinean maté and the traditional Portuguese soup, caldo verde.
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Ariège, from the Ariège Pyrenees to the Cathar Country Our journey begins in Foix, capital of the Ariège, its château, built on an impressive rocky peak, drawing innumerable tourists each year. In the steep-sided valleys of the Couserans, the horses and their transhumance rhythm the summer days. More discrete, Saint-Lizier and Mirepoix offer their gems from the Middle Ages. Directed by: Marie David (season 4, France, 2017)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Corrèze, the Dordogne Gorges Dramatic landscapes of high plateaux and steep-sided valleys carved by rivers, the most important being the Dordogne: discover the Haute-Corrèze, land of exceptional panoramas and a unique history. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Special feature on fashion design
Identity and change, haute couture's relationship to all aspects of fashion design with Stéphane Rolland. Gloves are more than a useful accessory: we meet the Swedish glove maker Thomasine Barnekow. Mugler, Dior, Chanel, Schiaparelli... Michel Carel goes behind-the-scenes to showcase the great designers' most extravagant ideas.
Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Patrick Jeffroy
In the Finistère, we meet the Breton chef Patrick Jeffroy and his disciples. This indomitable Gaul invites us to discover the unique people and ingredients that made him a Michelin-starred chef, all set against the spectacular background of the Brittany coast.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life in a geodesic dome Julien meets Mark and Chris on Gambier Island, where the two friends and professional skiers live in a geodesic dome. Julien gives them a hand with some of their on-going projects. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Should we be wary of bacon?
Despite its high nitrite levels, bacon continues to remains widely appreciated in Canada. Beware, or not? Plus: gleaning to reduce food waste, a vegetarian form of the famous General Tao chicken, and how to make turnips and swede totally delicious.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Myriam Fehmiu.

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Shortbread, clafoutis and chocolate clusters
For a speedy solution when you need a sugar fix, Ricardo presents three recipes that only take a few minutes and a single bowl to prepare: chocolate shortbread biscuits, cherry clafoutis and chocolate-coated blueberry-hazelnut clusters
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Hydration and dehydration
How can you tell if you are drinking enough? Also on the programme: Les Herbes Salées du Bas-Saint-Laurent; haggis, the famous dish from Scotland; and black garlic from L'Île d'Orléans...
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Poulet Jerk et frites de bananes plantains
programme.desc: Jerk chicken and fried plantain chips Paul Toussaint shares his recipe for jerk chicken and makes plantain chips to accompany. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Manon and Alain, Magdalen Islands After having taken the decision to sell their duplex right in the heart of Montreal, Manon and Alain set their heading for the Magdalen Islands. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: Rigoletto Three acts and four scenes for "Rigoletto", by Giuseppe Verdi, based on a play by Victor Hugo "Le Roi S'Amuse", created at the Teatro La Fenice in 1851. With extracts from Claus Guth's 2016 production at the Opéra de Paris. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Toronto, Ontario
Louis helps out at the house of someone who has involuntarily sheltered pigeons, squirrels and an entire family of raccoons.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: A little trip to Charlevoix Christian heads off to meet friends on the other side of the river, in the delightful region of Charlevoix. Pioneer in making the most of its terroir in terms of food, it offers a unique culinary trail under the expert guidance of the top chef Jean Soulard. Presented by: Christian Bégin.
